markdownRemark.html:
Everyone who has spent some time working with git irremediably knows about merging. The merge command brings the changes carried out in a B branch (new-feature) to the main branch A (master). It does work fine when the A branch is not being modified. If no conflicts arise, new changes are added on top the A branch. The log reflects an incremental order of commits, or put in other words, the commits are shown in the same order were added. A timeline of changes.

1c807d6 (HEAD -> master) Merge branch 'A'
71a621b (A) (A) A file updated
1ac6aff (B) (B) B file updated
2dc6065 (A) new A file
d657116 (B) new B file
d9ad32e A new commit is introduced while previous changes are in stash
13b16a5 Revert "README updated"
76a1097 Demo file updated
a31e004 README updated
44d4c5b New README file
ee42779 New demo file
